title: % Bonus Health increase has to return. HEAR ME OUT
body:
Why is % health increase a good thing?

- It improves heavy investment in tank items (it helps fulltanks)
- It avoids cases where people would become too tanky with just 1 item (S1 Atmogs meta)

%-health (or armor/Mr) increase is a way of balancing bulkyness for tanks  who build 4 or 5 tank items, without breaking it (bulkyness) for bruisers just who build 1 or 2 - like it can happen when single items are too efficient.

This is why last season's jungle tank item was a good "leverage" to start balancing tanks around. It created an itemization path where playing a fulltank made defense items significantly more (gold) efficient. Its removal was a step back.
It is a logical response to LW / VS ignoring % armor.
--------------
On a side note: Replacing "Runic Blessing" with an upgraded version of "Enchanted Armor" would be a good start.

Yes please I want Garen to become Raid Boss with 200/200 Armor/MR alongside 4.5K HP with two or three offensive Items at the same time.

And I'm not meaning it negatively, an item like that should really be added back into the game but with checks to ensure certain champions aren't able to abuse it in the long run. I mostly threw Garen out as an example as he normally builds 2-3 Damage Items coupled with his W's Passive boosting his defensive options allowing him to be extremely offensive and defensive (What Bruisers do, I know) at the same time. You can average 240 - 300 AD depending on which offensive items you build, alongside an average of 200 - 250 Armor, 160 - 200 Magic Resist, 400 MS, and 2,800 - 3,400 Health. Just trying to give an accurate representation of how a %Health item could benefit or break his durability which was originally why he had his W's Passive nerfed back when Defensive Itemization was strong in Season 3.

I'd just hate to see him nerfed again just for the benefit of other tanks, y'know? A lot of the pissy/bad players hate Garen because they think he's OP so they wouldn't care, but the people who actually like him wouldn't be too appreciative of that.

Well, lets use our imaginations here.

For the sake of argument we'll say that this bonus HP boost item builds out two Giant's Belts and a Ruby with a combine of 900 gold.  Also for the sake of argument, we'll say that this thing provides the same degree of cost-effectiveness for HP that Deathcap provides for AP, so it grants 980 HP and increases your Bonus HP by 30%.

So if you rushed it, that would snag you 1274 HP, about as much as a fully stacked old Warmog's for 300 more gold and no HP/5.

Alright, now we'll combine it with Mercs, Spirit Visage, Omen, Last Whisper, and Black Cleaver for another 1100 boosted up to 1430 bonus HP on top of the 2248 HP he gets for leveling for a grand total of 4952 HP!

So yeah, if this thing were as strong as Deathcap then it could make your Garen-based nightmare a reality.  Would that be swell?

Wouldn't be able to make it with three offensive items, though.  Gotta stick with two (or one and a half, since Cleaver gives HP).

You are basically saying that a champ without cc(except a silence), no gap closer, 2 defense items, 90 bonus ad in 2 weapons, and this pure hp item you imagine would be a nightmare. You can already hit 4k with 2 weapons and warmogs, those defense items, and have regen even while poked or fighting and have more damage. If a melee type is building a tank and not a big damage dealer, he needs to have something there to compensate since the damage itemization is stronger than defense itemization right now. I think it working with 2 hps items is fine as long as LW works with 2 damage items just fine.

> Wouldn't be able to make it with three offensive items, though.  Gotta stick with two (or one and a half, since Cleaver gives HP).

Oh lol, I said two or three because by a pure miracle a game lasts long enough for Garen to full build (Merc's/Cleaver/LW or IE/Visage/Randuins/New HP Item or Warmog's or Shiv) and there's not that strong of an AP on the enemy team, Garen can actually trade out Merc's for a Zephyr giving him some AS, CDR, Tenacity, more MS and Damage. It actually ends up being really efficient on him in the long run.

Though that's very situational lol, just thought I'd mention it for the fun of it, but I actually didn't really want that Garen thing to happen. :P I'm more just pointing out that there's certain Champions that'd be able to abuse a %Health item extremely well, and I'm just hoping that if one were to be added it wouldn't bring any nerfs to Garen since he'd be a huge abuser of it potentially.

Thank you for doing the math though!

Sorry if my original post came off as rude, but as much as I want an item like that to exist it'd be too easy to abuse. People don't really know how well Garen can balance out his stats and something like that being added to the game would be insane for him and other champions that can hybrid as well as he can. Garen can abuse Tank items just as well as tanks themselves can because of his W.

Stats however don't mean anything without the skills behind it.
Gare lacks a dash, which means he can easily be kited.
He has bad synergy with items, since attackspeed is a bad stat for him and his E as his main source of damage has only a 50% uptime and require him to basically stay on the targets head (meaning the other 50% of the time he's useless). As a result a single dash away from hiw makes him useless for the rest of the teamfight (considering how short and burst heavy teamfights have become).

His ultimate has a absolutely lack of synergy as well.
For some unknown reason it deals magic damage. 
This is horrible for Garen since nothing else in his kit benefits from it and the ability itself is so conditional and long cooldown that investing in it would be useless.

Overall Garen doesn't perform well, even though has great stats on paper.

Since it's really difficult to build GOOD health items if you're behind, the % health increase would be really useful.
Especially since the newest iteration of Warmogs only gives 800 health, you might as well get the Frozen Mallet, since it gives damage with only 100 less health.
I wouldn't exactly include blitz or sej on that list per se. Their damage is pretty bonkers.
But they have less damage than {{champion:23}}, {{champion:102}} or {{champion:122}}; respectively.

I would argue that Thornmail is a Soak item, not a Tank item.

Tank items increase your threat to the enemy team, encouraging them to focus you.  Heart does this with CDR (MOAR CC!) and the IAS nerf aura.

Thornmail is a purely selfish Soak item that exists simply to discourage auto-attackers from focusing you.

An item that multiplies your bonus resists would be... kind of redundant, honestly.  Hitting optimum resist values against both foes with and without %Pen is really, really easy.  Hitting optimum HP values against foes with %Pen is extraordinarily difficult.

I always thought it would be interesting if designated tank/bruiser items amplified the tankiness (health and maybe resists) of the other tank items, that way a bruiser doesn't get much effect from it, but a tank gets the full load (something like 5% more stats from tank items per item, totally to 25% extra stats)

> On a side note: Replacing "Runic Blessing" with an upgraded version of "Enchanted Armor" would be a good start.

This plus a small buff to the % bonus health runes would probably be enough to get the effect, maybe a mastery that granted +5% bonus health. You do need to be careful with % scaling though, since they can get out of hand pretty easily. When spirit of the anchient golem was around top laners were buying it just for the health boost despite it's other stats being a bit underwhelming.

Adding an item that gives a % bonus based on base health could be a workable solution though, since it would allow easier balance for specific champions Great for Alistar, not so much for Gnar). You already have the runes for %bonus health and the juggernaut mastery for total health, which would both scale off of this item.

I like the idea of replacing runic blessing with this though, building out of enchanted armor would be great for avoiding those awkward 1 points in block/tough skin, and it would be getting rid of the worst mastery in the defensive tree.

Another option might be to bring back the old leviathan passive but have it stack up like ROA, like:
